name: NPR
text:
A bipartisan group of ex-public officials is launching a $20 million public education campaign to highlight the safety and security of the upcoming election — even amid President Trump's efforts to discredit the outcome.
https://t.co/pRJx7hYDyu

name: NPR
text:
Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, who has refused to issue a statewide mask mandate, is squaring off with city and county leaders. He says local governments can require masks — but they can't enforce that with fines.
https://t.co/LuZFzHYZ9e

name: NPR
text:
Here are 5 questions to consider ahead of the #VPDebate tonight.
https://t.co/L5HvP5I31t

name: NPR
text:
This year's MacArthur Fellows — recipients of what's commonly called the Genius Grant — include filmmakers, scientists, dancers, scholars and more.

They'll each receive a no-strings-attached $625,000 award.
https://t.co/KhcVjYbrk1

name: NPR
text: As the White House and Democratic lawmakers continue to clash, the pandemic continues, millions can't afford food, and help doesn't appear to be on the way. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, we look at this growing demand and some potential solutions. https://t.co/QaXwHnjaNB

name: NPR
text:
California has implemented a new requirement for its biggest counties: To advance to the next phase of economic reopening, they will need to reduce the levels of coronavirus in their most vulnerable communities.
https://t.co/p6tfkG786y

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Live: Listen To The Vice Presidential Debate https://t.co/QPfzDXmku5

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: The Trump administration is asking the Supreme Court to allow it to end 2020 census counting early after a lower court ruled it must keep counting through Oct. 31 to give more time for accuracy.
 https://t.co/Ti1LDhyZWE

name: NPR
text:
Kamala Harris and Mike Pence are facing off in the first and only vice presidential debate of the election.

Join us for live analysis and fact-checks. #VPDebate
https://t.co/jUmPtU6Nnw

name: NPR
text:
The moderator Susan Page has started off the #VPDebate with a question about the coronavirus pandemic.

Watch live:
https://t.co/7HJPX4aPyN

name: NPR
text: Vice Presidential Debate https://t.co/5aX0Wa0yJ3

name: NPR
text:
More than 200,000 Americans have died from the coronavirus.

But President Trump on Wednesday took the opportunity to boast about his health, calling his positive diagnosis "a blessing from God."
https://t.co/DL5Qzp3ts8

name: NPR
text:
"The American people have witnessed what is the greatest failure of any presidential administration in the history of our country," Kamala Harris said of the Trump administration's pandemic response.
https://t.co/RHPXWxEzEc

name: NPR
text:
“We want a debate that is lively, but Americans also deserve a discussion that is civil," moderator Susan Page said at the top of the #VPDebate, making it clear her expectations for the night.
https://t.co/fsdf1HDlO7

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Vice President Pence claimed that "on day one, Joe Biden is going to raise your taxes."

That is misleading.

Biden's plan is primarily focused on high-income households — and he has insisted he won't raise taxes on income under $400,000.
https://t.co/snkDXhiHZV

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Pence claims when he and Trump took office "America had gone through the slowest recovery since the Great Depression."

That's an exaggeration.

It was the slowest recovery since WWII, but also a long, uninterrupted recovery for the job market.
https://t.co/on7NT2xO61

name: NPR
text:
Kamala Harris used a question about Trump’s doctors’ evasive answers to medical queries to remind listeners that the president has refused to release his tax returns — breaking 50 years' worth of precedent.
https://t.co/n1pF6dYC3J

name: NPR
text:
Kamala Harris on a possible coronavirus vaccine: “If the public health professionals, if Dr. Fauci, if the doctors tell us to take it, I’ll be the first in line to take it. But if Donald Trump tells us to take it, I’m not taking it.”
https://t.co/pZcrIDp3na

name: NPR
text:
Vice President Pence said "the American comeback is on the ballot."

That's a rosy economic outlook.

U.S. employers added 11.4 million jobs in the last 5 months. That's only half of the 22.2 million jobs that were lost in March and April.
https://t.co/EztRSv78Nj

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Pence said "when Joe Biden was vice president, we lost 200,000 manufacturing jobs.”

That lacks context.

Manufacturing jobs was already plummeting when Obama and Biden took office — the Obama administration did not cause that drop.
https://t.co/AQigGfz9T7

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Pence said "when Joe Biden was vice president, we lost 200,000 manufacturing jobs.”

That lacks context.

Manufacturing jobs were already plummeting when Obama and Biden took office — the Obama administration did not cause that drop.
https://t.co/6RsNfYrkjZ

name: NPR
text:
Vice President Pence says he and Trump "have a plan to improve health care and protect preexisting conditions for every American."

Trump has repeatedly promised to bring forward a GOP alternative to the Affordable Care Act.

He has not done so.
https://t.co/0U8Ox09xHa

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Vice President Pence claimed Joe Biden and Kamala Harris want to "ban fracking."

That is simply false.

Joe Biden has said that he opposes new oil and gas drilling permits on public lands — but would not call for a nationwide fracking ban.
https://t.co/nwH82RlgZx

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Vice President Pence again claimed that Joe Biden and Kamala Harris want to allow abortion “up to the moment of birth.” 

This is not true.
https://t.co/a2CtalgsCH

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Vice President Pence characterized the protests that followed George Floyd's killing as "rioting and looting."

That is misleading.

A recent report found that more than 93% of protests over the summer were peaceful.
https://t.co/vhqJJWFdo9

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Pence claims the U.S. "will have literally tens of millions of doses of vaccines before the end of this year."

The vaccines are being stockpiled — but that does not mean they'll be authorized for use (or available to the public) by that date.
https://t.co/PEADvWWo5W

name: NPR
text:
Kamala Harris criticized the Trump administration for weakening the U.S.'s standing with allies, citing a Pew Research report that found many leading nations had greater confidence in China’s President Xi than Trump.
https://t.co/N0E4yBaPKg
